message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CC 

This paper deals with the problem of index coding, which involves the transmission of messages to multiple receivers with different prior knowledge. This problem is closely related to information theory (cs.IT) and network coding (cs.NI), as well as communication complexity (cs.CC) and distributed systems (cs.DS). The paper also presents a new formulation for the problem, which involves the use of matrices, suggesting a possible connection to signal processing (cs.SI).
